Name: Veils Off in Sun or Shadow
QuestDesc:
To understand Gilberto's part in the Echo incident, you trace his steps to the outskirts of the city. But the deeper you delve, the more elusive the truth becomes...
The schemes of the Fractsidus are starting to unravel. Determined to seek the truth, you set forth to Averardo Vault...

Unlock.Name: What Yesterday Wept, Today Doth Sing

Dialogues.Speaker: Terminal Call
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're saying the Fisalia family was involved in the incident at the Carnevale rehearsal? Do you have solid evidence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not yet, Mr. Alberto. But the clues we found all lead to Fisalia family member, Gilberto. We will investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Terminal Call
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family... It seems they've run out of patience. This mess has got our honored guest into trouble and given these rats a chance to make their move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Terminal Call
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please pass on my thanks to our guest for the help. If you find yourselves short of hands or funds, do let me know. I'll be discussing this matter with Director Pacino.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will, sir. There's also another sensitive matter. It appears a Priest from the Cathedral of Mercury is involved, so it's highly possible that the Order is aware of this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Terminal Call
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order... Let me handle them. You just focus on Gilberto for now. Whatever the case, the Carnevale must be secured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Terminal Call
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This goes beyond the Montelli family. It's also about the faith and hope of countless Ragunnesi.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's from Mr. Alberto. He's the head of Averardo Bank. My superior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not really. It's from Mr. Alberto. He's the head of Averardo Bank. My superior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this doesn't sound like him. He's usually cautious and rarely makes outright promises unless one of the big shots in the family is twisting his arm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the top brass are alarmed, it can only mean that the situation may be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, maybe I'm overthinking this. Either way, we've finally got a lead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should search the area. See where Gilberto went.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
To your surprise, the Order's "confessional" turns out to be a freight elevator.
After leaving it behind, you arrive at Whisperwind Haven and meet Zani. Together, you set off to trace Gilberto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange, did Gilberto just vanish into thin air?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. A <ano=Flying Echo>Wingray</ano>, that explains it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wingray?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it's a type of Echo that can fly. People in Ragunna often use them to travel quickly between locations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Gilberto set up this Wingray as an escape route, it should lead us straight to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's use the Grapple to hitch a ride on the Wingray.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Gilberto's traces end here. Zani speculates that he must have left using a Wingray.
It seems Gilberto never anticipated that you two could also follow his lead and take the Wingray to where he was heading.

Chapters.Title: Use Grapple to interact with the Wingray

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quite the view isn't it, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to Whisperwind Haven—known for its iconic windmills and flower fields. Legend has it, this was once the home of the Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some people are over there. Let's check if they know anything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah we meet again, valiant champion of the foreign land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our paths intertwine once more. Ha, a result of Imperator's divine intervention, don't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, pardon me, but this lady by your side seems rather familiar...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Zani. I work at Averardo Bank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, yes. You look quite chivalrous, if I may say so. Yet with your weary face, I'm afraid I can only dub you the "Sorrowful Knight."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's quite fitting. Do I thank you for that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh, no need for the formalities. Allow me to re-introduce myself. I am Cristoforo, a humble playwright grappling with modern trends. Delighted to meet you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, I've been working on a script about the Blessed Maiden lately. The well-known Martyred Maiden, Fleurdelys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her brave sacrifice during the Dark Tide saved Ragunna many years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That sacred maiden perished just as the curtain fell, lying in the center of the sanctuary where spotlights converged. I've longed to capture that tragic scene in a play.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The script's nearly finished, but something's amiss. With Fleurdelys' home right here before me, I had hoped to find traces of the Blessed Maiden's early life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Childhood plays a key role in shaping one's personality, you know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sadly, no, I confess I've made zero progress. Most legends of the Blessed Maiden are lost to time. I'm forced to rely on imagination…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, nevertheless, the script is finished. I've even asked the children over there to help me rehearse it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, have a copy. I'm eager for your thoughts.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll take a look when I have time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem...

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, apologies. I started rambling about my play again. Well, then. What brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're looking for someone. Did you come across anyone from the Fisalia family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalias… Come to think of it, I had noticed a nobly dressed gentleman around here recently... Yes, he bore their crest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In fact, I even stared a bit. Old habits die hard. The Fisalias rarely venture beyond city walls, you see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Gilberto did pass through here... Thank you for the information, sir.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of that man... Word from the local villagers is that odd occurrences have plagued the area since his arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Odd occurences?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've likely noticed the abundance of Echoes here in Whisperwind Haven. One might say it's more their village than ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since that nobleman's arrival, Echoes in the area have been vanishing without a trace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like time lost forever, books forgotten by people, and cherished memories faded away in time's current... Oh, pardon me. My playwright's pen is running away again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echoes disappearing? Sounds familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm. Echoes started acting strangely when Gilberto showed up, just like what happened in the Carnevale rehearsal... This is no coincidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Cristoforo, do you know where those Echoes were last seen before they disappeared?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm in the dark as well. However, they might know a thing or two.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Echoes are keen to find their friends too. They're not fighters, but they can surely be your guide. Why not take them along?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You run into Cristoforo, the mysterious playwright, again. He's on a journey for inspiration to finish his script about the Blessed Maiden, "Fleurdelys."
As for Gilberto, he tells you that a Fisalia member has been frequenting Whisperwind Haven, and Echoes have been mysteriously vanishing.
Suspecting a connection, you follow the Echoes to investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brave Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lo! Foul monsters, taste my steel!

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Blessed Maiden smote the fiends who dared ascend the hallowed stairs. Yet the Dark Tide surged on, as more monsters poured forth from the mist."

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In this fateful moment, the Blessed Maiden beheld her destiny's end. Moved by the Divinity, she chose to yield her life, for the Sentinel's cause and Rinascita's people."

Dialogues.Speaker: Brave Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Imperator. Guide me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, wait. Your tone sounds a bit off. The Blessed Maiden should be more determined.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brave Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Determined? How about this then?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brave Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "In Imperator's name! Vile monsters! I swear your behinds shall be met with the end of my boots!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Kid
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I meant determined, not angry... You've got it all wrong!

Chapters.Title: Head to the place where the Echoes were last seen

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Everything seems normal here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Let's keep moving.)

Chapters.Title: Head to the place where the Echoes were last seen

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Hmm? There's something on top of that ruin.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Are those... corroded frequencies?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Need to find a way up there.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There are Fisalia markings on these crates. What's inside?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Something's being wrapped in these strange frequencies. I should clear them out first.)

Chapters.Title: Transform into Echo Lottie Lost to clear the corroded frequencies

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These are... petals?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I think I saw them before...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Something's wrong with these Echoes.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Looks like someone's pulling their strings, just like at the rehearsal.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Need to find a way to stop them first.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! You have returned!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did it go? Any discoveries to share?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Cristoforo and Zani what you found out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Intriguing. Frequency corrosion, you say? So these missing Echoes appeared out of nowhere and turned hostile?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is unheard of... Echoes are the Sentinel's gift to Rinascita. They're not supposed to turn on each other, much less humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, there was a similar incident with hostile Echoes in Ragunna City recently.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was more serious, and the Echoes involved almost hurt us. That's why we're investigating.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I presume the Fisalia you seek is entangled in this affair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... Very well. Allow me to offer you my thanks, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency corrosion driving the Echoes mad has been resolved, but we must still caution villagers and their Echoes. They should exercise vigilance and avoid perilous areas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cristoforo leaves in a hurry. It looks like he's on his way to warn the nearby villagers and Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we're dealing with a repeat of the rehearsal incident here… But if Gilberto was behind this, how did he pull it off?

Options.PlotLineKey: The petals might have the answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Petals? They give off a... strange feeling.

Options.PlotLineKey: Any ideas of what it might be, Abby?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright. Let's give it a try. Huh, tastes kinda weird.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not an Echo, or a Tacet Discord… The frequency's coming from a Resonator. A super strong one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Strange. Gilberto's a Resonator, but he doesn't seem… particularly strong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Be it the mastermind or another pawn, it's got the Fisalia family written all over it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They staged the accident, endangering civilians, and then used it to frame the Montellis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a story. This is definitely headline material. Just think of the leverage the Montelli family could get with this scandal...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}. Look, over there! That person looks kinda familiar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Phoebe! What's she doing here with all those Echoes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... I got an idea...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Upon reaching the area where Echoes have gone missing, you're attacked by out-of-control Echoes. After quelling them, you notice that they seem to be manipulated, just like the Vitreum Dancers in Ragunna.
Bidding Cristoforo farewell, you press on and encounter another familiar face—Acolyte Phoebe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Livia, Brenno! Any sign of Beppe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange, where could Beppe be...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Cut it out, Brenno! Stop that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, Brenno's right here. Then who's poking me in the back? Beppe, you better have a good expla—

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —Not Beppe. It's me. Abby!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eek!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hic...! Lame. I was just trynna have some fun with her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, it's you. Pardon me, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought you were at Ragunna City. Didn't expect to meet you here. Oh, uhh... Sorry, I don't think we've met.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, madam. My name is Zani. Averardo Bank.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't think we've met before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... It's probably because I haven't been to church much... Ahem. Please don't stare at me like that. There are more pressing matters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're investigating the Echo incident from the Carnevale rehearsal at Whisperwind Haven, as requested by the Montelli family. One of our clues led us here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Echo incident... Yes, I've also heard of it. I even heard you were caught right in the middle of it, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please accept my apologies on behalf of the Order.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay. I didn't get hurt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, have any of you seen an Echo named Beppe? They're about this tall and usually wander around here, but I can't seem to find them anywhere...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, we didn't see the Echo you mentioned, but we've found clues on their odd behavior. They all point to a member of the Fisalia family, Gilberto.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's also caused similar incidents here recently... Echoes went out of control and attacked each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order has also received reports of missing Echoes in this area. Is it possible that the Fisalia family is involved? I find it really hard to believe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I know, the Fisalia family is deeply respectful of the Divinity. How could they commit such a blasphemous act? The Echoes are gifts from the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you seen this before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A petal? The ritual one? No, wait... this frequency...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right! I think I saw this flower in the Cathedral of Mercury, and Priest Alessio was wearing it. Wait... Could he be involved with the Fisalia family's plans?

Options.PlotLineKey: No, we're still lacking key evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator granted us Echoes, the skies, lands, oceans, and sustenance. To which we should all be grateful and reverent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I request to join your investigation, {PlayerName}. As a servant of the Sentinel, I simply cannot turn a blind eye to their unholy acts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine by me. With someone from the Order as a neutral witness, the Fisalias won't be able to accuse us of fabricating evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As long as I'm not treated like a heretic and get kicked out of Rinascita later.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm okay with it as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, it seems we've reached an agreement.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beppe? Thank the Divinity, you're safe! But what happened to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait! Beppe... Oh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I got a bit carried away. Echoes don't usually act like this… Something must have startled them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something feels off. We should go check it out, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Phoebe reveals that she's searching for a missing Echo. You share your findings, and she realizes Gilberto's actions are blasphemy against the Sentinel, which calls for a punishment. With shared goals, Phoebe joins your team.
Suddenly, the missing Echo appears, fleeing as if being pursued. You decide to catch up to uncover what's behind its panic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. Everything is in place. Now, all we need is Her Majesty's approval.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O great Imperator. May you raise the tides, deliver your edict to our Queen, and let the clouds cover Ragunna, cleansing it of the wickedness left by the pleasure-seekers of this city of transgression.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is he praying? I know the Fisalias are extremely devout, but who is this "Queen" he mentioned?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This prayer sounds... odd. It's definitely not from the Order's Codex.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Divinity in the Abyss, Lord of Tides and Riddles, may you soon be freed. Let all lies melt away under your power. May you grant me strength to overcome all who oppose you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lord of Tides and... Riddles?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Who's there!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh-oh, things just went south. Looks like we've got a fight on our hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must be that outlander, right? The news of your arrival is all over Ragunna...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since you're here, I guess you've uncovered quite a bit... Though it's insignificant compared to the truth beneath the tides.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As a gesture of goodwill, let me offer a word of advice: Curiosity won't lead you to the truth you seek, but rather closer to—

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: —Your impending doom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He just turned Echoes into Tacet Discords. Is it the petals?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... What have you done to those Echoes!?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merely the neccessary sacrifices for our one true Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You finally pin down Gilberto, who is reciting eerie prayers.
On seeing you, he transforms the nearby Echoes into Tacet Discords with a Lycoris flower. A fierce battle ensues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! This cannot be!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How pathetic. You're nothing but a discarded pawn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Which is not unusual with the Fisalia family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Gilberto, please explain this "Lord of Tides and Riddles" you mentioned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I appreciate your passion for the Order, Miss Phoebe, but now is not the time. We need to uncover the real culprit behind the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, forgive me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you really think you've won? No, it's already too late... Haha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I might just be a pawn, insignificant and small, but while you're focusing on me, you've missed something far more important.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He shows no remorse for his crimes. I'll contact Mr. Alberto and have the family send someone to take over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? That's the... The Nimbus Sanctum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Echoes... are converging towards the sea of clouds. What's happening?

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha. Muahahaha! Magnificent! Lorelei is now ours for the taking... Just as the prophecy foretold! All shall be cleansed!

Dialogues.Speaker: Gilberto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, let us wait in patience as the sea of clouds descends to engulf that corrupted city. Only the faithful will rise anew from the tides!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lorelei?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the Codex, Lorelei is a powerful Remnant creature residing in the Atrium of Reflections at the center of the Nimbus Sanctum.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends say the sea of clouds once flooded the Seminary of the Forgotten, reducing it to ruins, before spreading to Ragunna. It was Lorelei who curbed the raging clouds and ended the crisis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If... if they've really done something to Lorelei, then Mr. Gilberto wasn't just bluffing. The clouds might truly engulf Ragunna, leading to a disaster beyond our imagination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are all mad... So this is what they've been planning all along.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have to do something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You two go ahead. I'll stay here and watch him until the family arrives, just in case he gets any bright ideas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll stay with you. After all, this could provoke outcry from the Fisalia family. If I testify about Gilberto's misdeeds on behalf of the Order, they can't deny the facts or exploit the situation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I agree. But what about you, {PlayerName}...

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I can take care of myself!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All right. There's a port nearby where you can catch a Gondola. It can take you close to the Atrium of Reflections.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After we hand Gilberto over to the family, we'll meet up with you as soon as possible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please be extra careful, {PlayerName}! May the Sentinel protect you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Despite his defeat, Gilberto continues to preach a dark prophecy: Lorelei will command the sea of clouds to engulf Ragunna, sparing only the faithful. Meanwhile, an anomaly at the Nimbus Sanctum suggests Lorelei might also be influenced by a Lycoris.
Zani and Phoebe stay behind to watch over Gilberto until the Montelli members arrive. You head to the sea of clouds alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Harbormaster
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome, traveler. I am the harbormaster. Where do you wish to go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Harbormaster
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You intend to navigate the sea of clouds? Surely you've noticed today's weather… I'm afraid it's far from ideal for sailing.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this kind of weather unusual?

Dialogues.Speaker: Harbormaster
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, we've seen storms before, but nothing like this. I wonder what's causing it. I suggest you sit it out before departing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Harbormaster
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. If that's the case, you can take the Gondola in the harbor, but please be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Upon reaching the port near the sea of clouds, you prepare to board a boat to the Atrium of Reflections, but the port's services are suspended due to the anomaly. Fortunately, the harbormaster lets you take a Gondola yourself.
With no other options, you search the port for an available Gondola.
Aha. Perfect… There's still a Gondola here. I believe your name is… Noah, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Echo Boat
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Gentle sounds of approval*
It seems fate has brought us together once more. Don't you agree? Kind {Male=sir;Female=lady}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're…?
It seems you do remember me. That's right. We crossed paths at Madame Nyarla's mask shop.
Truth be told, I need to catch the final train in the Nimbus Sanctum today. However, this lone Gondola is all the harbor offers.
So… since we share the same destination, would you mind also sharing this Gondola with me?
Much obliged.
Well, then. Without further ado, let's be on our way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
While searching for an available Gondola, you encounter the noble lady you once met at the Masked Reverie.
She asks to travel with you to catch the train in the sea of clouds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This song... where is it coming from?
That's Lorelei's song, guiding ships through the mist.
But her singing sounds a bit different today. There are hints of... sorrow and agony...
Perhaps it's merely my fancy. Regardless, her melody will guide us through fog and storm to the heart of the Nimbus Sanctum.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola to the train station

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The cloud continues to spread. You may be right. This could be Imperator's test, but we must leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mature Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do as you please! I'm not leaving. The relic of the Ancient One is here somewhere. I must...
How intriguing. These seem to be Reverberations hidden in the sea of clouds.
Perhaps you've heard that this was once the Order's seminary. It appears that even after the clouds consumed it, the Reverberations of its members linger on.
Maybe the anomalies in the sea of clouds are stirring them to life once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem very knowledgeable about all this.
Why yes, I've long been fascinated by Ragunna's history and art. After all, to chart our future, we must first understand our past. Is that not true?
We're likely to encounter more Reverberations on our way. They may even contain vital information. You can search for more if you're curious.
It seems we have some time before the train arrives. How about a little chat to pass the time?
Well, then. Where shall we begin?
"The city, an abomination of chaos, claims its first death at birth. Its mortality has become our sustenance, like a whale that slowly sinks into the abyss."
This comment on Ragunna comes from Rosselli, a painter from the past. Tragically, he died in poverty, his work overlooked. Now, ironically, even a mere sketch of his commands over a million Credits.
Now. What is your impression of Ragunna so far?

Options.PlotLineKey: A profit-driven place full of corruption.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Passionate... Indeed. Passion is a quality the Ragunnesi possess in abundance. It's also why the Carnevale is so eagerly anticipated.
Indeed. Ragunna is not as glamorous as it seems. Beneath the veneer of prosperity, avarice reigns supreme.
Indeed, faith is Ragunna's crown jewel. Our devotion to the Sentinel stands unrivaled throughout Rinascita.
A most prudent response. Perhaps you're still acquainting yourself with Ragunna, or you simply prefer discretion. Either way, I take no offense.
Ragunna has many facets. Most people only see one side of it, but for me—
It's like two sworn enemies are forcibly bound together. That's Ragunna—a city where tradition and innovation, openness and isolation, ceaselessly wrestle for dominance.
That is why the Montelli and Fisalia families are in a constant clash, as you may have seen.
The Montellis champion innovation, staking all on the Carnevale. Meanwhile, the Fisalias cling to tradition, colluding with the shadows that lurk in Ragunna's depths.
Fortunately, this long struggle behind the curtains will soon come to an end. Not because of the two families, but because of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me?
Yes, you. The Fated One. Perhaps you're not merely entangled in Ragunna's conflict, but are, in fact, the very eye of the storm. The city's fate may well rest upon your shoulders.
You may have not noticed it yet, but we are... and have been in the same boat for a long time.
Ah. There's the train. It's time to say goodbye now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't catch your name.
I'll tell you next time. As for now, let's keep it a mystery.
Until we meet again, Fated One. May you find your own path in Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You arrive at the Echo train station and wait for its arrival.
During the wait, the noble lady shares her thoughts on Ragunna City, the Montelli and Fisalia families... and you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the mysterious lady departs, Zani and Phoebe arrive on a Gondola. Together, you set off toward where Lorelei resides.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is what's become of the seminary? I never expected this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've been here before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, but I've seen paintings of the seminary in the Cathedral. It had an enormous dome and spires that seemed to touch the heavens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then the Order was forced to abandon it when the sea of clouds swallowed it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reunite with Zani and Phoebe at the Atrium of Reflections。

Chapters.Title: Head to the Atrium of Reflections

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you also come to repent and seek forgiveness?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel has revealed a path to resist temptation and corruption. We need only devote ourselves wholly... to Lorelei.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're just here to see Lorelei.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Patience. I see your eagerness for enlightenment, like our new brothers. You've removed your masks, but your hearts… they're still veiled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone here wears a mask. Everyone in Ragunna. Without exception, never unmasked. This is the source of our suffering. The mask veils our hearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like our new brothers, they wear peculiar masks of madness. Poor souls tormented by evil desires. May they find peace in Lorelei's embrace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, their masks are filled with madness, but even wrongdoers can seek redemption from Lorelei. The Sentinel granted Lorelei this authority, and no one can take it away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow Lorelei's song and your heart, and you may meet our lady. But if your transgressions are... beyond redemption, you'll be lost in the sea of clouds forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what should we do to see Lorelei?

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you seek an audience with Lorelei? Sadly, you've come at a bad time. Lorelei is furious, and our mortal bodies can't withstand her wrath. We've sealed the path to her domain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We appreciate the explanation, but we believe Lorelei is in danger... We're here to help her. Someone's planning to exploit her powers...

Dialogues.Speaker: Masked Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path has been closed. You must leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Sigh) Doesn't look like we'll be talking our way past him. Let's find another way, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the Atrium of Reflections, a masked believer tells you that the path to Lorelei's domain is sealed. Unable to reason with them, you begin investigating the place to find an alternative way forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A veil of mist shrouds the Atrium, radiating an aura of resistance. This must be the entrance that the believers refer to as "the path to audience."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, it's completely sealed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Small words are carved beside it: "We mourn the martyrdom of the Blessed Maiden."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this some kind of hint?

Chapters.Title: Search for clues to opening the path to audience

Dialogues.Speaker: Happy Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. I have been cleansed of impure thoughts. I can finally escape from my wrongdoings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sing, dance! For we have been granted peace and freedom!

Dialogues.Speaker: Happy Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we only need to relish this moment!

Dialogues.Speaker: Cheerful Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh! You've also come to rid yourself of your misdeeds? Then join us! Sing! Sing with us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Happy Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The door has been shut. Simply sing along and it will open before you!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Just "Sing"? Doesn't look like we'll get more out of them. Let's go check somewhere else.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These inscriptions and markings on the stela seem to say something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But most of these are worn out and don't look like modern Rinascita script. Phoebe, can you read any of it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's see... This seems like an ancient holy script dedicated to recording the deeds of Sentinel Imperator. As for its content...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I shall grant this power to... the Night... Queen. May she... during the day... sea of clouds..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. Much of this text is illegible. However, the adjacent drawing is mostly intact. It shows Sentinel Imperator speaking to a massive creature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the creature slowly shifts from an immense, amorphous form into a humanoid shape.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be Lorelei? After all, no other being that large lives above the sea of clouds....

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, I'm not sure if the other figure is the Sentinel. It looks a little different from the Cathedral statues. Maybe it's just the lack of clarity in the drawing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, does it mean... Lorelei and the Sentinel are somehow connected to each other?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing about the barrier though. Are there any other clues?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Misteltein! You're here!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Misteltein"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *growl*—

Dialogues.Speaker: "Pixie"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chirp*!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Misteltein. One of the missing Echoes. They probably followed the singing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Misteltein, do you know how to remove the barrier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now how would an Echo know that, Phoebe—

Dialogues.Speaker: "Misteltein"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *growl*—

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say that we just need to sing a specific song.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Misteltein"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Nods)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-You can understand what it's saying?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A specific song, huh? That's a direct lead. But which one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess "singing" is our only option for clearing that barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But which song?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The stela we saw mentioned the Sentinel, and we're in the ruins of the seminary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meaning it should be a "chorale"? There are also the inscription in front of the barrier: "We mourn the martyrdom of the Blessed Maiden."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any chorales you know ring a bell, Phoebe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The martyrdom of the Blessed Maiden... Could this be the "Aria of the Blessed Maiden"? It's a chorale rarely used these days. I doubt most Priests even know of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Blessed Maiden? We met a playwright named Cristoforo earlier. He shared some stories about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe, if you know this chorale, why not give it a try? It might just clear the barrier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: M-me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O-okay then. I suppose it's our best option at the moment. I'll give it a try. Ahem...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Through investigation, you realize that the key to unsealing Lorelei's domain is a "chorale."
With encouragement from you and Zani, Phoebe gathers the courage and sings the melody. The song unlocks the sealed passage before you.
A song of false nature. Masking... A twisted view... Tear it to shreds...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you get the chorale wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure I sang the "Aria of the Blessed Maiden"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not good... She doesn't seem too pleased with that one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That flower... looks like the petals we found in Whisperwind Haven.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the Fractsidus. I've dealt with them before, and I've seen a flower just like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How long have I been in slumber... This nightmare... How long was I trapped in it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you also part of the dream?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, we are not... Might you be Lorelei?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am. Travelers from afar, I sense… the kindness pulsing in your hearts. You must be the ones who broke the chains of my nightmare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The oathbreakers, hiding behind their Masks of Madness… They tainted the Nimbus Sanctum with corrupted blooms, drowning me in rage and sorrow. Endless nightmares became my prison.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Masks of Madness... I recall those people at the entrance of the Atrium mentioned it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Had you not freed me from my nightmare, I would never be able to fulfill the Sentinel's task… The tides of the Nimbus Sanctum would have engulfed the whole of Ragunna, just as they once claimed the sacred temple now lying in ruins beneath you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. The Sentinel? Does that mean...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, the Sentinel molded me from a mindless being to the form you see, and bestowed upon me the most precious gift... A soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They commanded me to restrain the clouds and prevent the Remnant Energy within it from... dissipating.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you contact Imperator? I need to meet with the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, it lies beyond my power. The Sentinel's link to the mortal realm is severed. Only through collective prayer, and a rite, at the height of the Carnevale, only then can mortals briefly commune with Them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A rite... You mean the Carnevale?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's impossible! The current Primus, Fenrico the Enlightened One, was given a direct oracle from the Sentinel. The Sentinel has always been with the people!

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid the Sentinel's current state... transcends mortal understanding. Your Primus is no exception.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should doubt linger in your mind, I implore you to await the rite's completion. The Sentinel will surely answer the people's call—not your so-called… Enlightened One.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One last thing. Those oathbreakers wearing Masks of Madness you mentioned, do you know who they are?

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All that I know is that they are not from Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the whispers between dreams, I heard them speak of their leader, a woman they called…

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "—the Conductor."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Conductor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is time I return to my slumber. Their wicked acts have scarred the sea of clouds, and I must mend it… within my dreams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Lorelei
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The song shall guide you out of this domain. Farewell, visitors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You defeat the "Queen of the Night," Lorelei's corrupted form under the Lycoris's influence, and restore her to her true self. Besides, you also find the Vitreum Dancer that fled away, but it is damaged while protecting you. Zani keeps it in the Montelli's Terminal.
Lorelei, a remnant creature enlightened by the Sentinel, reveals a shocking truth: the current Primus of the Order is not the legendary Enlightened One. The Sentinel's link to the mortal world has been severed, and only the Laureate of the Carnevale gets a chance to communicate with Them.
Lorelei also discloses the identity of the one causing Echoes to lose control—the Conductor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a wild turn this job's taken… Seeing the legendary Lorelei up close? Almost makes it worth the trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? Are you all right, Phoebe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? I-I'm fine. I'm just… processing Lorelei's words. Forgive me, I… I need a moment to reflect.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In any case, we managed to stop their plot in time and found the missing Vitreum Dancer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of that Vitreum Dancer… What brought it here? Lorelei's song, or maybe the Sentinel's guidance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But those wearing the Masks of Madness... The Fractsidus, right? I'm curious about their role in all this. I think they supplied Gilberto with the flowers to turn Echoes into Tacet Discords.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, the Fractsidus is behind this.
Their actions remind me of something...

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's our next move, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right... Those snakes lurked in the shadows, using Gilberto as their fall guy. We can't expose them just by ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, another thing. Since the Fractsidus is conspiring with the Fisalias, that makes them an enemy of the Montelli family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There happens to be an auction at Averardo Vault today. The top members of the family will be there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should tip off the family about the Fractsidus' scheme. The Montellis can't afford to ignore this threat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about you, Phoebe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I intend to return to the Order first. While I believe Lorelei is truthful, I can't imagine the Primus would deceive our people. He is, after all, the <ano=Sentinel's Resonator>Enlightened One</ano>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to Lorelei, the Sentinel will deliver an oracle during the Carnevale. That's when the truth will come to light.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, are all Primuses called the <ano=Sentinel's Resonator>Enlightened One</ano>?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, only Lord Fenrico has ever directly communicated with the Sentinel. Previous Primuses were merely indirect representatives, not the Enlightened One...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Silence and composure are gifts from the great Imperator. I'll keep today's events between us, locked away in my heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I believe this is where we part ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Codex reminds us, "It is not the lighthouse that guides us through the storm to safety, but our own eyes fixed on the shore."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd like to offer these words to you—may your eyes always shine bright with clarity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Shaken by Lorelei's revelations, Phoebe decides to return to the Order to seek answers and bids farewell to you.
With Lorelei's information, you are certain that Fractsidus is behind the chaos among Echoes.
You and Zani head to Averardo Vault, the heart of the Montelli family, to seek allies and repair the damaged Vitreum Dancer Echo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the same Echo boat we were on earlier... Was it also attracted by Lorelei's singing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Noah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A gentle cry*

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's called Noah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Noah... Well, I can't understand what it's saying, but it's a perfect timing. We can have it take us to Averardo Vault.

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola to Averardo Vault
Ride the Gondola to Averardo Vault

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a really big waterfall... Is there no way up?

Dialogues.Speaker: Noah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *An expressive cry*

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, really? You can take us upstream?

Dialogues.Speaker: Noah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A cry of certainty*

Chapters.Title: Ride the Gondola up the waterfall
Ride the Gondola up the waterfall

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another waterfall. You sure about this, Noah?

Dialogues.Speaker: Noah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A confident cry*

Chapters.Title: Head to the vault's main entrance

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Averardo Vault is just up ahead. It seems this is where we part ways, Noah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Noah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *A cry of understanding*

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure it can find its way back to the harbor. Don't worry. Now, we just need to follow this path to reach the vault. Let's go.

Chapters.Title: Head to the vault's main entrance

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? You're saying someone attacked our base?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bewildered Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woman... Jewels... Very strong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great. How do I talk to Overclock-fried morons like you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well? Are you the only one who made it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bewildered Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lord Overseer... Powerful. I... Leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No idea what you're talking about. Whatever. I've linked you up. Now, let's bail. The Montellis don't welcome us here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bewildered Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Who are you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, the Montellis called in some muscle, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bewildered Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Tense Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enough. Take 'em out!

Chapters.Title: Head to the vault's main entrance

Dialogues.Speaker: Gate Keeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to Averardo Vault. Do you have an appointment?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Zani. I'm an employee of the bank. Here's my ID.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gate Keeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, this invitation… My apologies. Welcome to Averardo Vault. How may we assist you today?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're not here on business. We've come to brief the family on the Echo incident from the recent Carnevale rehearsal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gate Keeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll arrange that immediately. Please proceed to the main entrance. A staff member will greet you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Gate Keeper
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please proceed to the main entrance. A staff member will greet you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have bigger things to worry about. Just let me handle this.

Chapters.Title: Head to the vault's main entrance

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These Echoes... Are they guarding the vault?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. But I've never seen them in action before. The "Averardo Bank Employee Manual" says they can easily take out a whole squad of Resonators.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, this doesn't apply to someone powerful like you, {PlayerName}. Still, their combat skills are formidable. Their mere presence is enough to make everyone feel safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This facility houses nearly half of Rinascita's wealth. It serves all of Ragunna's citizens, even including the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite our feud, no one in Ragunna can refuse the services of Averardo Vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What the... I thought they only responded to hostility!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steady now. Don't move. It's on high alert but won't attack unless provoked. At least, that's what the Employee Manual says!
Stand down.
I apologize for the small mishap on behalf of the Montelli Family. And...
What a pleasant surprise to see you again so soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you.
Yet your expression betrays no surprise, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to properly introduce myself. My name is Carlotta, Carlotta Montelli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Montelli… You are the…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The second daughter of the Montelli Family, yes. Please feel free to call me Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, I trust the renumeration meets your satisfaction, Ms. Zani?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was you who tasked me with receiving {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surely a distinguished guest such as {PlayerName} deserves the attention of our most trusted employee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm aware of your purpose here. On behalf of my family, allow me to extend our deepest gratitude for your endeavors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your eyes show curiosity about me and my role in this… drama. However, this isn't the place for such discussions. Please follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You are stopped by Echo guards at the outer part of Averardo Vault. Just as tensions rise, the noble lady you met before shows up, commanding the guards to stand down.
She formally introduces herself as Carlotta Montelli, the second daughter of Montelli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please accept my apologies, {PlayerName}, for withholding my true identity before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita's affairs have grown… intricate. The Fisalia family, the Order of the Deep…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've likely noticed that many desire the Carnevale to fail. We Montellis, having tied our future to its success, became their target.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …But, let's not dwell on that for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are. Welcome to Averardo Vault—the Montellis' heart and glory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you do me a favor, Ms. Zani? Please secure the evidence in the property room and... fetch me the "jewelry" and "perfume."

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jewelry and perfume? You mean…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, yes. You know where to find our… "dressing room," I presume? Inform the "stylist" it's my request. She'll prepare everything. Meet us at the vault's side entrance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. I'll go right away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Onto the real matter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surely you've sensed it—a darker force lurks behind both the Order and the Fisalias.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct. We Montellis have had some… unpleasant encounters with them. Their motives remain shrouded, yet the Order and the Fisalias clearly benefit from them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family's interest aligns with yours. An uninterrupted Carnevale for you… an unfettered Ragunna for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The invitation we sent was meant to be a token of goodwill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd appreciate it if you could return the favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Splendid. So we are in the same boat, again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must first deliver the evidence you and Ms. Zani collected to my uncle, Mr. Capollo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He oversees Carnevale affairs and liaises with the Fisalias. I'm sure he'll find the Fractsidus information… most intriguing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm afraid I must take my leave. Please, feel free to explore the vault at your leisure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta leads you into Averardo Vault, explaining that her family is aware of the Fractsidus's evil doings and is willing to help.
She plans to deliver the evidence you've collected to her uncle, Capollo, who will arrange a formal meeting to exchange information about Fractsidus.
Before the meeting, you take time to explore the vault.

Chapters.Title: Meet with Carlotta at the front desk

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, Lady Carlotta. I've just confirmed with the office that Mr. Capollo is not in the vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's quite alright. Please inform me the moment he returns.

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, {PlayerName}. I'm afraid we've hit a slight snag.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just learned that Uncle Capollo was called away on pressing matters, so we won't be able to see him at the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This does alter our plans, but worry not. I already have some other surprises up my sleeve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please come with me. We need more privacy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, remember Gilberto?

Options.PlotLineKey: The noble from the Fisalia family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, thanks to you and Ms. Zani, he could not escape and is now in our custody.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family gave him a rather… spirited "welcome." As it happens, his bravado crumbled quite quickly. Once he saw the Niumbus Sanctum restored, he sang like a canary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your quick action has secured us vital intelligence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To put it simply, Gilberto revealed that we have traitors in our family.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which is not entirely surprising. Our family has always had its cracks. Given the right incentives or pressures, human weaknesses are all too easily exploited.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd actually begun to look into this matter before your arrival at the vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now it's confirmed that the traitors are in the vault's <ano=Frequency Modification>tuning</ano> room, doing what they believe to be secretive with the help of the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now they probably won't even notice us with their attention fixed on the property room.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess that they are desperately destroying any evidence against the Fisalia family and the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Right, as for the next move, I have a plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's an alternate passage into the vault leading straight to where they are. We can surprise them when they least expect it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I can't manage this alone... I could really use your help.

Options.PlotLineKey: Your plan is bold, but practical.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm glad I have you with me, {PlayerName}. Please take a moment to prepare, and I'll see you at the entrance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After waiting for Carlotta for a long time, you search for her and discover she's in trouble—Capollo has vanished.
In private, she reveals information from Gilberto's interrogation: there are traitors in the family who have been bribed by Fractsidus.
Carlotta requests your help to reach the traitors' hideout deep within the vault via an alternate passage. She hopes to capture and interrogate them to gain more information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Everything has been taken care of, Lady Carlotta. Here is the "jewelry" and "perfume" you requested.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect. Thank you, Ms. Zani.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I have one more task for you, one of utmost importance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need you to guard the property room and stop anyone who attempts to break in, whatever it takes—by force if necessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Is someone targeting the evidence?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, it's only a precaution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave it to me. I'll make sure no one touches the evidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we've implemented a two-tier security system. Once inside, please hold your position until I signal. I'll clear the path for you from above.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, you may need to use the Terminal to unlock the path on my side.

Options.PlotLineKey: Two-tier security system? Could it be…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Sadly yes, our family built this vault with the foresight of possible betrayal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most family members only know how to pass one of the two layers. And alliances forged amid all these locks tend to breed treachery and mistrust.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To enter the vault without being trapped to death, two people must have absolute trust in each other. So... do you trust me, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Not really, but we have the same goals.
We are already in the same boat, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very sensible, but good enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I appreciate your trust. It will not be abused.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, very good. I can work with that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, let's go, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Before you enter the alternate passage, Carlotta assigns Zani to create a diversion by drawing attention of the traitors' helpers in the property room.
With everything in place, you and Carlotta prepare to venture into the depths of Averardo Vault.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you hear me, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Loud and clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just a moment, I need to access the upper control room to unlock the door on your end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you hear me, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Loud and clear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just a moment, I need to access the upper control room to unlock the door on your end.

Chapters.Title: Find way to get the key card

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cameras here. Good thing I came prepared. Recall the "jewelry" I asked for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In family parlance, it's this handy little tool that generates crystals to cover these cameras and blind them for a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Done, but it won't last long. I have to keep moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hurry, take cover! We're almost exposed!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems we're in the clear now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's move on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Vitreum Dancers on patrol here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily, they can be trapped with the crystals as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I must be careful, the security level ahead will increase.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did these artifacts get here? Hmm, strange.

Chapters.Title: Find the mechanism in the secret room

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm seeing some scatter prisms here. Ornaments, that's what they were designed to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they can also amplify my Resonance power… Might be useful at some point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the surveillance cameras have increased. This bodes ill.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, if "jewelry set" means this gadget... what about "perfume"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just another weapon… For my family, many things must be kept discreet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it's not always verbal. Sometimes a glance or a gesture can speak volumes, which, of course, demands a deep mutual understanding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Quite a few cameras here... Could the prisms be of any help?

Chapters.Title: Shoot the Scatter Prism to immobilize the Vitreum Dancer and cross the corridor

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Found some prisms here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll use them to pass through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …This doesn't seem to be working.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll try a different one.

Chapters.Title: Immobilize the Vitreum Dancer to pass through the room
Operate the console in the control room

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm in the control room, just a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Switching view to your side now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Done... The door before you should be open.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beyond the door you should find the other control room. Beware of the patrolling Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, there should be a monitor you can operate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me know once you find it.

Chapters.Title: Operate the console in the control room

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm at the monitor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Give me a moment. I'll upgrade your access so you have control of the vault's systems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like some Echoes are approaching. Stay alert.

Chapters.Title: Operate the console in the control room

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you see me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Clear as day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to cross the hall from above. People might spot me if I make too much noise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So could you maneuver these chandeliers to form a pathway for me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Lower the chandelier on the right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait… the chandelier dosen't seem to be positioned properly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Splendid, I've made it across.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's my turn now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll see you in a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The door should be open, {PlayerName}, and we will soon meet—

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}? Looks like the signal has been jammed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank the Sentinel, it didn't set off the central alarm. I should still be under the radar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew, and it saved me some footwork.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Must be more cautious…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path is blocked… Wall-dashing seems to be the only option.

Chapters.Title: Use Wall Dash to bypass the obstacles

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a screen?... Perhaps I can use Grapple to pull it over.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These scatter prisms might come in handy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The future of Rinascita... rests with all of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Montellis will make sure everyone has a equal share of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna will enter a new era united.

Dialogues.Speaker: Francesco
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: United under the promise of our Terminals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Heh.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta, hello?!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The comms are cut off. She must be in trouble.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gotta hurry up.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Need to get rid of them fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blockdown is lifted. I need to keep moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, can you figure it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's try again. The frequency of the Tacet Discords… What a genius idea, but I can't reverse-engineer the frequency it's using.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seems like the key is not these flowers, but their creator. She must be an insanely powerful Resonator to be able to… shatter and recontruct these frequencies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we'd better speed up. Once their plan succeeds, there won't be another chance like this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-who sounded the alarm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's me. Most likely by mistake. I apologize for interrupting your work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: La…Lady Carlotta? How… what brings you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, nothing, just curious what you are working on, locked away in this tuning room…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flowers. No doubt they're from the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Care to defend yourselves? While you still have the chance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta, we… we're just following orders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following orders, you say? Do you recall the very first "oath" we all took upon joining the family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: None… shall h-harm the family's interests.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And?

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Any who defy shall…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall be brought to reckoning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've appropriated family assets and turned these Echoes into… ticking time bombs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once they detonate, the countless efforts and fortunes spent on the Carnevale will all vanish instantly, taking the Montelli's name and future with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Professional Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta, p-please, we can explain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Vault Security
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's going on here? Oh, Lady Carlotta…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just in time. I've found some family traitors. But hold on, I have a few more questions for them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will only ask once. Who are you taking orders from?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only know he's one of the top brass in the family… always using encrypted channels and ordering us to pick up flowers from masked strangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How many of these Echoes have you made?

Dialogues.Speaker: Serious Tuner
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …A lot. The first shipment reached the venue as early as a week ago. They look so identical to regular ones that even we can hardly tell them apart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take them away and scrutinize all their recent transactions, including the source of every last credit. Then handle them as per the family rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Vault Security
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, ma'am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I appreciate your help, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew those <ano=Frequency Specialist>tuners</ano> wouldn't dare do this alone. Someone far more dangerous is pulling the strings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Using Echoes to disrupt the Carnevale, having family weakness on a silver platter… enemies within are far more deadly than those without.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their schemes won't prevail. I will not sit idly by and watch them ruin the long-awaited Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're done here. Let the guards take care of the rest. So, Ms. Zani mentioned you heard the Sentinel's oracle when you met the Vitreum Dancer?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Not directly, but close enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The seasoned artisans in our family restored the Vitreum Dancer you retrieved and discovered something fascinating in its records.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come with me. This might answer your questions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and Carlotta reach the tuning room in the depths of the vault and catch the tuners tampering with the family's Echoes using Lycoris.
Intimidated by Carlotta, they confess their betrayal: they altered the Echoes and sent them to the rehearsal venue.
While the traitors are taken away, Carlotta suspects an even more dangerous traitor is involved.
To thank you, she offers to take you to the family's Echo Collection Room, where you might uncover connections between the Sentinel and the Vitreum Dancers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are. The true splendors of Montelli's heritage.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are these all Echoes in the cases?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, and no. They are Echoes but also the promise of Rinascita's future—and, above all, freedom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita may be a fledgling country, but it boasts centuries of history. Its foray into the wider world, however, only began a few years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't you find it peculiar? Rinascita, the Land of Echoes… leads the world in Echo technology, yet stands so insular and unadventurous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you suppose is behind all this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "Echoes" themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sharp as always. Rinascita's Common Echoes are bound to Genesis Nexus, making seafaring with them almost impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But their power is essential for dealing with Tacet Discords and other threats at sea. You could say the reliance on Common Echoes has shackled our ambitions to venture beyond our borders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To break these shackles, the Montelli family has invested in Reserved Terminals. It's not about short-term benefits, but the future for the whole of Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order has monopolized the use of Common Echoes and kept a tight leash on Reserved Terminals, claiming that individual ownership would sully the sanctity of the Echoes they so fervently preach about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you see their real objective, don't you? To keep Rinascita isolated so they can shape its entire narrative.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Fisalia family has covertly aligned with the Order, aiming to crush our efforts and therefore the prospect of Reserved Terminals. They've even gone so far as to seek Fractsidus' aid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such is the reality of the Land of Echoes—whoever controls the Echoes controls Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My forebears began collecting these Echoes long before the Vault existed, when the Montelli family was nothing more than a third-rate house ridiculed for its adventurous spirit.
