Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They ventured out to sea for trades and got their hands on Terminals of the most basic model. From there, they've been tirelessly collecting Echoes and advancing the technology. Brick by brick, they built this enterprise that you see today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are probably wondering, how does this relates to the Vitreum Dancer? Well, the one that came to you at the Carnevale rehearsal is among our family's earliest Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As both the first Vitreum Dancer and the prototype for the frequency tuning of all subsequent models, its value is truly unparalleled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was never meant to be deployed and should have been preserved here in a case forever. But somehow, it found its way to the Carnevale… just to meet you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you're saying…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is no coincidence. I can only assume it was the design of Sentinel Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here are some files about the Vitreum Dancer. Perhaps they can offer you some insights.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
In the Echo Collection Room, Carlotta proudly presents the family's treasured collection of Echoes, symbols of freedom and the Montelli commitment to developing Reserved Terminals for exploration beyond Rinascita. Common Echoes rely heavily on beacons and can't be used at sea, limiting exploration outside Rinascita.
Here, you find the first Vitreum Dancer, the prototype for all other Vitreum Dancers—the same one that had empathy with you in the city.
Carlotta suggests this is no coincidence. The Sentinel may be using this Vitreum Dancer to send a message.
You decide to delve into the archives on Vitreum Dancers for further insight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I trust you've read the files. The original Tacet Discord for the Vitreum Dancer emerged from the frequencies of shattered stained glass in the tower ruins, a place forbidden by decree of the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the Codex era, those stained-glass windows were used to depict the tales of the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Out of all of the Echoes, they chose the Vitreum Dancer to deliver Their message because—

Options.PlotLineKey: It will lead me to the Order's hidden truth.
It will lead me to the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... my thoughts exactly. The Order's secrets must somehow be connected to the Sentinel's fate.

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know all this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montellis have long pursued the buried secrets of Rinascita—the Order's tampering with the Codex, and the mysterious erasure of the "Age of Ignorance" and the "Age of Conflict" from our history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anything can break the chains around Rinascita and grant freedom to all, it must be the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the quest for this truth is also part of our endeavor to restore connection with the wider world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, that's all I have to offer. Did you want to visit the ruins? Though I'm not sure what there is to uncover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case, I'll accompany you. The family will take care of everything else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The archives reveal that the original Tacet Discord for the Vitreum Dancer emerged from the frequencies of shattered stained glass in the tower ruins, a place forbidden by decree of the Order. The stained-glass windows were used to depict the tales of the Sentinel.
Carlotta is also intrigued by the Sentinel's message, which seems to be guiding you to hidden truths about the Order and the Sentinel's location.
Together, you prepare to venture to the tower ruins.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator and return to the main hall

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you're back. I've done everything you asked, Lady Carlotta. All the thugs trying to storm the room were handled.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, they walked straight into the trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, we set a bait the traitors could never refuse. You aren't injured, are you, Ms. Zani?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course not. I saw a squad of security guards charging into the vault. Did anything happen in there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait… no, never mind. Best I don't know. Whatever's going on in the vault must be family business.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, it's all sorted now, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, now you can take a break. I've spoken with Mr. Alberto, and he's agreed to grant you a very generous vacation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I don't really mind. My pay already came through… but vacation is always a bonus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. These adventures beat office life by a mile.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Is that... the central alarm of the vault?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could be a backup plan from the traitors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we see what delights they've cooked up for us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Passing through the Averardo Vault lobby, you see that Zani has completed her task.
However, the vault suddenly shifts into full lockdown—perhaps a backup plan from the traitors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta, we have a situation. The guardian Echoes deployed outside the main entrance... have gone rogue for unknown reasons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've initiated Security Protocol Four, evacuating civilians and non-combat staff. Our security teams nearby are trying to suppress the Echoes. But…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are short-handed. Even the bank staff have been whisked away to the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Y-yes, ma'am. If possible, could you authorize access to the vault's Echo Collection…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That won't be necessary. I'll address this personally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Front Desk Attendant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-but, your safety…

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I've got her back. I'm with the bank's security team, and I've handled my fair share of these emergencies.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm also up for some action.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you both… Now, let the show begin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the reception desk, you learn that the Echo guards outside the main entrance have lost control. With most staff reassigned for the upcoming Carnevale, Carlotta decides to handle the situation personally.
You volunteer to help her deal with the emergency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Make it quick and clean.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Copy that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the site, you're forced to subdue the rampaging Echo guards by force.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Vault Guard that lost control
Defeat the Vault Guard that lost control

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Zani, do you mind handling the cleanup? I'm sorry. I just promised you a vacation... but looks like it will have to wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh it's fine. Just a bit of extra work. I can't stand by and watch my colleagues getting hurt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, you have bigger things to worry about. Just let me handle this.

Options.PlotLineKey: We can always count on you, Zani.
Be sure to get that overtime pay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, yeah… That's the burden of being good at my job.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's more to this attack than it seems.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order must have been behind it, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. At this juncture, neither the Fractsidus nor the Fisalias have any reason to interfere. It's some hidden truth about the Order the Sentinel is leading us towards.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The traitors must be watching us, knowing truth is on the verge of revelation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a feeling that whatever's coming next… will not be easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After defeating the Echo guard, Carlotta asks Zani to handle the cleanup.
You both head quickly to the tower ruins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Wingray. Let's hitch a ride, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're nearly there. That's the tower ruins, our destination.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where my family first found the Vitreum Dancer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you see in the shattered stained glass?

Options.PlotLineKey: It seems to be telling a story.
Is there a way to piece them together?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This seems to chronicle a legend of the Sentinel and the tale of how the first Primus founded the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've learned of this history before but many details have faded over time.

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know all this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, art investment is one of our family's key ventures, so I've naturally picked up a thing or two along the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a stone tablet over there. It might offer some clues about these stained glass images.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Arriving at the tower ruins, you find shattered stained glass telling the Sentinel's legend and the Order's founding by the first Primus.
An ancient stone tablet stands nearby, waiting to be deciphered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This ancient stone tablet bears inscriptions in the ancient Rinascita language.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Which translate roughly to…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Once whole, the Divinity was rent by warring creeds. From Their holy wounds sprang the curse of Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …On this day shall I depart. Though the woes of Rinascita yet endure, the shattered Divinity hath chosen Their herald.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …On the grandest of days, the maiden, crowned with golden laurel, shall commune with the Divinity. Thus she becomes the prophesied "Enlightened One," through whom Rinascita's woes shall end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to be some sort of prophecy… We might have to piece together the clues from both the stone tablet and the stained glass to unravel the secrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These ancient relics that spawn Tacet Discords often carry special frequencies—likely the key to restoring them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's use the Terminal's Sensor to reconstruct their frequencies and align them with the tablet's inscriptions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta successfully deciphers the prophecy inscribed on the stone tablet.
To fully understand it, you may need to piece together the information from the tablet and the stained glass.

Chapters.Title: Use Sensor to restore the frequencies of the stained glass pieces

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies of these pieces have been reconstructed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we only need to assemble them onto the stained glass. The last step to the secrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one shows a man in Primus attire, wielding a lantern-shaped relic to dispel shadows and the monsters within.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last one seems to depict the moment a girl communes with the Divinity of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This seems to depict the people of Rinascita torn into two warring factions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's done. Now let's see…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like these stained glass images recount a tale about the Divinity. Wait...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just... the content is rather peculiar. I'll translate it for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You restore the frequencies of the stained glass using your Sensor.
With that, Carlotta tells you a legend about Rinascita's divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita has two divinities? I've never heard of such a thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family archives hold many documents on Rinascita's past, yet none mentioned two divinities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Ragunna, the common belief has always been that Sentinel Imperator is the only divinity of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if the images on the stained glass windows were fabricated, why would the Order deface them and declare this tower forbidden?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's only one explanation. These are not fabrications but buried truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this is indeed the Order's doing... we must leave here immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: North of this tower is an island.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It should be beyond their reach. Once we get there, you will discover another truth the Order has buried—

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Options.PlotLineKey: They surely know when to show up.
You go first. I'll cover you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Interesting, they're here even faster than I anticipated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta is stunned by the revelation: the legend speaks of two divinities in Rinascita, with the Enlightened One depicted as a young girl—a sharp contrast to the Order's teachings. She suspects the Order destroyed these ruins to conceal this truth. She hints that another secret lies on a northern island, but before she can elaborate, the Order's pursuers arrive.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the Echoes sent by the Order

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apparently, the Order believes the images on the stained glass to be real.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They wouldn't even hesitate to break their façade of neutrality, just to ensure we don't take the secrets out alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at what you have done, distorting history, usurping the Sentinel's authority, and... colluding with wretches.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are your accomplices? The Fractsidus, the Fisalias, and even some of the Montellis, am I right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Order Envoy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem… I'm afraid I don't understand, Miss Carlotta. It seems you too are lost to madness and hallucination…

Dialogues.Speaker: Order Envoy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you find yourself confused and desire the Sentinel's guidance, I would gladly arrange... a personal Pilgrim's Sail for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is how you treat those truth-seekers? Banish them in the name of pilgrimage?
—Please, lower your weapon. There is still room for discussion, is there not, Miss Carlotta?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta swiftly defeats the pursuers and tries to pry out more information, but Priest Alessio soon arrives with reinforcements.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stand down. Enough blood has been shed today. Imperator would not revel in senseless sacrifice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Pilgrim's Sail is for the transgressors to seek rebirth, not for you to threaten our friends. Repent for your reckless words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Order Envoy
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Forgive me, Brother Alessio.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, honored guest. You have been misinformed, as the truth is not what it seems. My lord Fenrico has arranged your audience with the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why not hear the Sentinel's wisdom for yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, if Lord Fenrico is the true "Enlightened One."

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, the prophecy speaks of a maiden as the "Enlightened One." Is that why you destroyed the stained glass? To pass Fenrico off as the Enlightened One? So he can seize the Sentinel's power and rule Ragunna?

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you stubborn people of little faith. You've surely been tempted by evil and swallowed its lies. Lord Fenrico is the undeniable Enlightened One and will guide us all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, I see no point in debating doctrine with you. Let's move on to a more concrete subject. Now, Miss Carlotta, which one do you think is more important to the Montelli family?

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it "Profit"…

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …or "Bloodline"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How… that's… Uncle Capollo's pendant? What did you do to him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good question. What did we do indeed? Quite a faithful one he was.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wouldn't hand over this pendant, the emblem of his faith... but we managed to persuade him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether he should be deemed faithful now depends entirely on your actions. And you know what will become of him if we decide his devotion is weak and unworthy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …My actions? What do you want me to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Raise your weapon, faithful Carlotta. Choose wisely now… Where shall you aim? Whose heart will taste your bullet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good. You are a smart one, Miss Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Carlotta?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. Even though the time we shared was… very memorable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. It appears you've made the right choice as any true Ragunnesi would, honoring blood and faith alike.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pull the trigger. End this transgressor's life. The Sentinel shall host a supreme banquet for you in the high heavens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, and may you meet your friends… where it all ends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …You've disappointed me, Miss Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a saying in Ragunna, even the finest bullet can miss. It was only a mistake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So be it. I shouldn't question your faith over such a mishap... It is after all insignificant in the grand scheme of the Divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Priest Alessio
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us bear witness, to the moment divine wrath descends from the heavens.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Unable to persuade you to give up, Priest Alessio shows Capollo's pendant—proof of his capture—and uses the family tie to force Carlotta to "make the right choice."
Carlotta quickly forms a silent plan. She pretends to aim her gun at you but instead shoots to dislodge debris, blocking the pursuers and opening an escape route for you.
Now, it's time to head to the northern island and uncover the Order's buried secret.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew, that was close… I really thought the bullet was coming for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So… was it all part of your plan?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were improvising.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then you two sure have great chemistry… Anyway, those bad guys are still after us, so let's get out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't Carlotta say something about an island up north? Let's go check it out!

Chapters.Title: Avoid the attacks and find a way through the Wailing Ascent
Avoid the attacks and find a way through the Wailing Ascent
